pros: Staff at flow Caritas are lovely very kind and helpful
cons: Speaking very personally the role was not suited to me and the morale at the Charity I began working for was low .. management distant and arrogant I left  because of this not due to Flow Caritas .

pros: When I first joined we had a great team of people who could fuflfil their job descriptions.
cons: This company was run into the ground by management that cared more about their own life projection than that of the buisness. Won a tribunal case against them for constructive dismissal but conveniently liquidated only to set up under a new name… human led.

pros: This is a recruitment company that definitely adheres to the needs of the client! From the inception, the company has made sure that I have had support every step of the way in accordance to the recruitment process, and they have ensured to include ease with the application of the required job. No only do the staff remain contact with you during the job to make sure you are well taken care of, but you also attain a sense that they really do care about their customers, which is a feeling that I do not think that I have felt with any other company before. Something that is also of the upmost importantance is the fact that not only are they professional, but they are genuinely good at what they do. Flow Caritas is definitely a company worth considering, and I would recommend it to anyone seeking a company that has high standards!
cons: In my opinion, the only downside is that I could not stay for longer!

pros: I work as part of the Barnardos team in Bristol. It’s a fun job and really good if you are looking to meet new people or get to know the area. Everyone I work with is friendly and I would class a friend. The charity it’s self is a great one to work for. Weekly pay and good pay means you are not short of cash! Management are very understanding and easy to talk to if you have a issue. I have worked for many fundraising companies and I would say here is probably the best place I have been treated. Also good room for progression.
cons: I would say no cons for flow but on the door it’s self it can be upsetting if you are having a bad day. However the team I work with never fail to cheer me up and the management team always provide extra training and support.

pros: Jade is absolutely fantastic! She replies straight away to any queries we have and is extremely polite and just a bundle of joy to contact. She always makes my day when I contact her for any queries and is very knowledgeable about the company and procedures. I have thoroughly enjoyed being part of the team. Magda is extremely lovely and gets any questions I have about pay sorted out straight away! She is extremely pleasant to talk to and is a lovely individual. Definitely the best agency I have been involved in so far! Thank you for all your hard work!
cons: Absolutely no cons at all!

pros: I have been an employer using flow and employee working for flow on both occasions I had amazing experiences
cons: honestly none at all they helped me in so many differant ways

job_title: Senior Team Leader At Shelter in Glasgow, Scotland
pros: Jade Gargan! Jade has gotten me several great opportunities within the last year and is an absolute pleasure to correspond with. She had gotten me interviews within an hours notice when I needed work and calls me almost weekly just to make sure im happy. Most often we just generally talk about our lives and work takes a backseat half the time. I am very happy to work with FlowCaritas and dont intend leaving them any time soon
cons: None I can name right now

pros: The girl that recruited me (Holly) was incredible at her job. She was chatty and friendly and represented her company so well! She knew what Marie Curie were looking for and even sat in on our training and interview. Flow really put the effort in when hiring people and it shows. Amazing company overall!
cons: I have had no bad experience at all with flow.

pros:
Flow Caritas are a caring, positive and proactive company that works with a conscious spirit to give the best to their employees as well as as for the clients, finding a perfect balance of motivation and push.

Rewarding for goals achievements 

Great charity cause 

Motivational and supportive team and team leaders
cons: You will walk a lot in any weather conditions and you’ll go through tough emotional times due to the constant interaction of any kind of individuals.

pros:
There was a sense of family at Flow. There was never any hesitation or anxiety at the prospect of having queries or questions, everyone is so welcoming from the get-go that you instantly feel part of the team.
Even now since leaving the company I feel if I needed advice I might be tempted to contact Jade!
cons: I honestly didn’t have a single bad experience with Flow. Genuinely, I can’t think of one.

pros:
Communication from the moment of application was straightforward and instant.  
I never had any confusion regarding my hours, holiday due or pay.   
The representative I had contact with was always the same, very cheerful, motivating and friendly.
cons: Perhaps that I never met anyone face to face, although this was counteracted by the accessibility and friendliness of the one person who contacted me throughout application,  training,  and employment.

pros: The reason I loved working at Flow Caritas was the flexibility of work as I am self employed it made it easier for me to choose when i wanted to work.  The team are very friendly and understanding environment.
cons: Door to door fundraising was hard especially when getting to areas far out, when the weather is hot in summer.

review_title: To be honest, I personally love it.
job_title: Door to Door Fundraiser in London, England
pros: The hours are VERY reasonable and the pay is perfect imo, much more than what others are earning at my age, any age if that.
cons: I haven’t worked for long, so i’m genuinely yet to get any con, they pay on time and even give you your balance on the holiday pay. Mon-fri with weekends and bank holidays off, i see no reason to complain.

review_title: Fantastic and supportive place to work
job_title: Senior Account Manager in Sheffield, England
pros:
Supportive and wonderful manager 
Flexible work from home options- great work life balance 
Good annual leave entitlement- get your birthday as a an extra holiday day!
Close supportive team
No micro - management, but readily available training and support when needed 
Clear progression path 
Regular reviews
Management always open to new ideas 
Management care about employee well-being
Realistic team targets
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: D2D Deputy Fundraising Manager in London, England
pros: I started working 3 day after my phone interview, I now work as a Deputy Manager for the same charity I was placed with 3 years ago by flow. Flow found me a job for life!
cons: Holiday pay needs to be clear when it crosses over at new year. Unseen holidays are not useful if we don't know what we have to take.

pros:
- Always friendly
- Always available to answer queries 
- 100% helpful and supportive 
- Good with advice for first time fundraiserers
- All round top organisation
cons:
- I literally have nothing bad to say. 

Maybe that I've never met any of them for a pint

job_title: Face Too Face Fundraiser in London, England
pros: Great team constant updates, encouragement, motivation and appreciate the hard work we all do for a great cause
cons: When it rains is pours its cold and people don't wanna talk too you :( just have too try be their sunshine in a rain u day :)

review_title: Nearly full time as do extra hours every week
pros: Nice friendly staff. Always reply to your queries. Will to go extra to help you solve any problems you may be having.
cons: Not like going into your local office and being face to face with your manager, which I find more satisfying.

pros: the agent who got me both of my jobs as a fundraiser, Ellen, was so helpful and caring. She was able to book interviews for me with only 1 or 2 days wait, and kept in great communication between me and the charities. Payroll always on time, any questions always answered almost straight away.
cons: none really, they were always helpful

review_title: Moved into management with the care and support from the team
pros: Well looked after and efficient in what they do :) also understanding in working with different people from all backgrounds, from working with Ellen for some years and now with the bubbly jade it was a pleasure getting to know them as individuals as well.
cons: Not having some Glasgow based staff

pros: Excellent service from Jade, always very persobable and approachable.  Willing to assist with all aspects of the role being undertaken.  Jade built a fantastic working relationship with me - despite having never even met me. Even after my assignment ended, Jade is only too happy  to help.
cons: I'm not working with Jade any more!

pros:
Flexible working hours, home working available, supportive management.
Development and training ongoing. You get to work with amazing clients and you get to speak to inspiring candidates who want to make a difference whilst working for a charity.
cons: It's a targetted environment but if you like working ina supportive team and you like a challenge then it's great.

pros: They are really helpful in explaining anything on your payslip, any questions about tax in general (I’m new to paying tax) and keep in contact and ask how I’m getting on with the job.
cons: The only con would be that I’m not directly employed by the charity I work for. But that’s no fault of the flow caritas of course!

pros: Approachable, Informative, Professional, Responsive,  The job is interesting and varied, Career and personal development -Great team and atmosphere
cons: I am unable to think of any. Every job has it's challenges of course but there's nothing that is think negatively.

pros:
Weekly pay
Holiday pay easy to claim
Accountable staff
Opportunities for flexibility of work
Good opportunities for recruitment bonuses
cons:
Little long term security to job
No benefits for working for the agency for a long period of time
No sick pay, forced to take holiday pay if ill

job_title: Door to Door Fundraiser in London, England
pros: Fun team, friendly agents and weekly pay
cons: Holiday system and travelling to far locations

review_title: Best recruitment agency I’ve ever worked for
pros: They’re absolutely fantastic, payroll is flawless, communication is brilliant and super friendly.
cons: The hours that I do are tiring, though that is my choice. Hours are very flexible at Flow.

pros:
- Very helpful in assisting when issues arise
- Make very good job recommendations

- Respectful staff
cons: - Occasionally very slow with query responses or applications unless you chase them up

review_title: Great to work for this company
pros: Great communicators, they support you every step of he way, are proactive, and also respond to any questions or issues you have super quickly
cons: Can't think of any cons

review_title: Pros and Cons at Flow caritas
pros: Easy to speak to, great advisory team, friendly staff, holiday pay is easily accessible. References for future employees mean extra money incentives.
cons: Sometimes slow feedback after email correspondence

pros: They’re very organised at getting work! I spoke to Jade and within an hour I had an interview and within two days constant work! Jade is amazing, always bubbly and enthusiastic!!!
cons: I have no cons with Flow!

pros: Great communication from Flow caritas, especially in regards to booking off holidays and sending payslips. Have never had any issues whatsoever!
cons: No cons! Have never had any issues and have had a great experience.

job_title: Fundraiser in Hockley, East of England, England
pros: They bend over backwards to help you get the right job that suits you.
cons: There are no cons only pro’s

pros: Flow Caritas placed me immediately when I completed my original contract.
cons: Can’t think of any as my experience has been great.
